name: Leftover Pork Roast BBQ Wrap
author: Judy in Delaware
summary: I was tired of the same old, same old doings with a leftover pork roast, so tried this out one night for dinner. Now we're hooked on 'em!
ingredients: ½ pound cooked pork roast, shredded
½ small onion, thinly sliced into rings
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Spoon 1/2 the shredded pork onto each tortilla; top each with 2 tablespoons barbeque sauce, 4 Cheddar cheese halves, 1/2 the onion rings, salt, and pepper
Fold opposing edges of each tortilla to overlap the filling
Roll 1 of the opposing edges around the filling into a burrito-shape
Wrap each tightly with aluminum foil and place on a baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until cooked through and cheese is melted, 15 to 20 minutes
Cut each wrap in half to serve
